content_blocks.text: Valuation is both art and science. In this post we'll walk through the three common approaches: Discounted Cash Flow (DCF), Comparable Company Analysis, and Adjusted Net Asset Method (ANAM).
Build a cash flow forecast for 5-10 years, estimate terminal value, choose an appropriate discount rate (WACC), and discount back to present value.
Select comparable firms, derive multiples (EV/EBITDA, P/E), and apply the median multiple to your firm's metric.
Useful for asset-heavy businesses; adjust assets & liabilities to market value and net them.
Conclusion: choose the method (or blend) that best reflects the firm's cash flow predictability and asset intensity.
